data.title: couple Jomari, Aiko win as councilors in respective cit
data.meta_description: How sad that both Herbert “Bistek” Bautista and Monsour del Rosario failed to make it as senators. Former Quezon City Mayor Herbert had no less than ac...
data.meta_site_name: Malaya Business Insight | The online version of Malaya Business Insight. Published at the same time with the same content for the major sections.
data.text:
How sad that both Herbert “Bistek” Bautista and Monsour del Rosario failed to make it as senators.

Former Quezon City Mayor Herbert had no less than actress and beauty queen (international, ha) Ruffa Gutierrez as an ardent supporter.

Ruffa’s mom, talent manager Annabelle Rama, also supported Bistek’s senatorial bid.

In the case of Monsour, a taekwondo expert, he got support from his fellow sports enthusiasts and followers.

***

Former child actor Nash Aguas is now a councilor in Cavite City.

Nash was a former member of the children’s show, “Goin’ Bulilit.” He formed a love team with Alexa Ilacad, who is now a singer, songwriter, dancer, host, vlogger and model.

In the past, Alexa has admitted to have really fallen in love with Nash, who served as her inspiration when she wrote and composed the song, “Paano.”

Well, the two have kept mum about what transpired between them.

***

The two have their own partners now. Jomari is with Abby Viduya, while Aiko is with Jay Khonghun.

Reelected as first district councilor of Paranaque City is actor Jomari Yllana.

Jomari was accompanied by girlfriend of several years, actress Abby Viduya, during his proclamation.

Meanwhile, Jomari’s first wife, actress Aiko Melendez, is also a councilor – in Quezon City’s fifth district. She is supported by her boyfriend, newly elected Zambales Representative Jay Khongun.

“He (referring to Congressman Jay Khongun) may be my forever,” Aiko said.

Aiko has been married twice. She tied the knot with Martin Jickain after her marriage to Jomari was annulled. She and Jickain have a daughter, Marthena.

***

We are glad for actor-politician Jinggooy Estrada, who won a seat in the senate.

His half-brother, JV Ejercito, also seems poised to return to the senate.

Jinggoy and JV are, of course, the sons of former President Joseph Estrada from two women. Jinggoy’s mom is Dr. Loi Ejercito, a former senator, while JV’s mom is former actress Guia Gomez, who was a former mayor of San Juan City.

How the two will behave in the Senate floor, that’s what we should look forward to.

Ang bongga, pag nagkataon.

***

Robin Padilla remains on the top spot in the senatorial race, followed by broadcaster Raffy Tulfo.

Antique Representative Loren Legarda is in third place.

Will Mark Villar remain in number four up to the proclamation? Mark’s name only became a byword when he became secretary of the Department of Public Works and Highways during the term of President Duterte.

Mark, a former congressman, is the eldest child of businessman Manny Villar and Senator Cynthia Villar. He is married to Emmeline Aglipay, who was also a former congresswoman.

The couple have a daughter, Emma.

***

Wherever he may be, the late Comedy King Dolphy must be truly happy for youngest son Vandolph for again winning a seat in the Paranaque City council.

“Ako, I’m ultra happy for him,” Vandolph’s mom, the still-sexy actress Alma Moreno, said.

“Kasi, isang accomplishment ito. Kinailangan, for one, to earn the trust of the people. Kinailangan din na malaman ng tao na gusto mo talaga silang mapagsilbihan, kaya tumatakbo ka for the position.

“I’m proud of Vandolph. I’m glad I’m his mother,” she happily added.

An only child, Vandolph was spoiled by both Alma and Dolphy.

“But he never took for granted his studies. Nakita kasi niya ito sa kanyang mga older siblings, lalo kay Eric (Quizon),” continued Alma. “Iminulat din ng mga ito na dapat nagbabasa siya araw araw ng pahayagan para maging aware siya sa nangyayari sa kanyang paligid. O kaya gawing habit na manuod ng balita sa TV.

“Sana, all young people do. Sa paraang ito, magkakaroon tayo ng compassion sa ating kapuwa, na hangad din natin na madama nila para sa kin.

“Pray natin na God be with us always,” the 62-year-old actress further said.
